intro: Monnina solandrifolia, commonly known as the redroot sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes species like willows and evening primroses. Monnina solandrifolia is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils in its native habitat.
